bugs.title: moodle: security issues fixed in the upstream 2.7.1, 2.6.4, 2.5.7, and 2.4.11 releases [fedora-all]

bugzilla.short_desc: moodle: security issues fixed in the upstream 2.7.1, 2.6.4, 2.5.7, and 2.4.11 releases [fedora-all]

blocked.short_desc: moodle: security issues fixed in the upstream 2.7.1, 2.6.4, 2.5.7, and 2.4.11 releases

long_desc.thetext:
The upstream 2.7.1, 2.6.4, 2.5.7, and 2.4.11 Moodle releases fix a number of security issues:

https://moodle.org/mod/forum/discuss.php?d=263858

Details of these issues will be available in one week.

Created moodle tracking bugs for this issue:

Affects: fedora-all [bug 1120979]
Affects: epel-all [bug 1120980]

Details of each issue are now public:

http://seclists.org/oss-sec/2014/q3/195

This is an automatically created tracking bug!  It was created to ensure
that one or more security vulnerabilities are fixed in affected versions
of Fedora.

For comments that are specific to the vulnerability please use bugs filed
against the "Security Response" product referenced in the "Blocks" field.

For more information see:
http://fedoraproject.org/wiki/Security/TrackingBugs

When creating a Bodhi update request, use the bodhi submission link noted
in the next comment(s).  This will include the bug IDs of this tracking
bug as well as the relevant top-level CVE bugs.

Please also mention the CVE IDs being fixed in the RPM changelog and the
Bodhi notes field when available.

NOTE: this issue affects multiple supported versions of Fedora. While only
one tracking bug has been filed, please correct all affected versions at
the same time.  If you need to fix the versions independent of each other,
you may clone this bug as appropriate.

[bug automatically created by: add-tracking-bugs]

Use the following update submission link to create the Bodhi request for
this issue as it contains the top-level parent bug(s) as well as this
tracking bug.  This will ensure that all associated bugs get updated when
new packages are pushed to stable.

IMPORTANT: ensure that the "Close bugs when update is stable" option
remains checked.

Bodhi update submission link:
https://admin.fedoraproject.org/updates/new/?type_=security&bugs=1120978,1120979

moodle-2.4.11-1.el6 has been submitted as an update for Fedora EPEL 6.
https://admin.fedoraproject.org/updates/moodle-2.4.11-1.el6

moodle-2.4.11-1.fc19 has been submitted as an update for Fedora 19.
https://admin.fedoraproject.org/updates/moodle-2.4.11-1.fc19

moodle-2.5.7-1.fc20 has been submitted as an update for Fedora 20.
https://admin.fedoraproject.org/updates/moodle-2.5.7-1.fc20

Package moodle-2.5.7-1.fc20:
* should fix your issue,
* was pushed to the Fedora 20 testing repository,
* should be available at your local mirror within two days.
Update it with:
# su -c 'yum update --enablerepo=updates-testing moodle-2.5.7-1.fc20'
as soon as you are able to.
Please go to the following url:
https://admin.fedoraproject.org/updates/FEDORA-2014-8601/moodle-2.5.7-1.fc20
then log in and leave karma (feedback).
moodle-2.4.11-1.fc19 has been pushed to the Fedora 19 stable repository.  If problems still persist, please make note of it in this bug report.
moodle-2.5.7-1.fc20 has been pushed to the Fedora 20 stable repository.  If problems still persist, please make note of it in this bug report.
moodle-2.4.11-1.el6 has been pushed to the Fedora EPEL 6 stable repository.  If problems still persist, please make note of it in this bug report.
